Other Information.Test Conditions: 25 °C, varying transmembrane pressures from 12.5 to 150 psi
25 °C, varying transmembrane pressures from 12.5 to 150 psi
2000 ppm NaCl solution, DI water as feed, FO setup
Other Information.Additional Info: Salt rejection rate was 99% for monovalent ions.

Other Information.Test Conditions: 2000 ppm Na2SO4 solution, DI water as feed, FO setup
Other Information.Additional Info: Salt rejection rate was 99.5% for divalent ions.

Other Information.Test Conditions: 2000 ppm MgCl2 solution, DI water as feed, FO setup
Other Information.Additional Info: Salt rejection rate was 99.5% for divalent ions.

Sieving Mechanism: The smaller pore size (Pore diameter: 1.698 nm) of the EGCG-modified IPN membrane hinders dye molecule transport to the permeate based on the size-sieving mechanism.

Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Water flux ranges for EGCG@PPP-IPN from 128.2 to 585.5 LMH at 12.5 to 150 psi pressure; Dye rejection performance was ∼98%; Salt rejection rate was 99.5% for divalent ions and 99% for monovalent.

Other Information.Additional Info: The highly negative charged (Zeta potential: −28.56 mV) EGCG-modified membrane surface would bind the positively charged dye and salt molecule by electrostatic attraction, resulting in the dye-treated permeate.
